author: barnabasbusa
content: Devnet 12 seems to struggle right now, we are looking into it

author: g11tech
content: reth doesn't seem to be responding

author: barnabasbusa
content: it seems like all reth nodes are struggling actually

author: marcinds
content: I spammed today with a few thousands of 6-blob txs and a few thousands of 1-blob txs - was trying to check if nethermind blob pool is correctly keeping capacity. Finished spamming about 1h ago. Seems like devnet-12 problems may be triggered by my action, not sure why

author: barnabasbusa
content: <@&1070471163219824730> and <@&595681804422479873> are the ones reporting major issues

author: pk910
content:
there are some nimbus clients producing orphaned blocks ( nimbus-nethermind-1-arm, nimbus-besu-1,  nimbus-geth-1),  each of them basically has their own chain.
the clients where reporting `Block quarantine full (blobless)` for some time and are forked off since then

author: pk910
content:
Besu in prysm-besu-1 & prysm-besu-1-arm is having problems building blocks since an hour ago.
There are some stack traces in the logs.  Can someone from <@&836981603216654336>  have a look?
only the prysm pairs seem affected,  but the errors look bad

author: marekm3498
content: <@412614104222531604> I think more clients than Nimbus and Reth have issues

author: barnabasbusa
content: I think some of it was caused by OOM

author: barnabasbusa
content: 8gb ram is just really not cutting it anymore for devnet 12

author: marekm3498
content: question if: this is not limited and clients would OOM with 16GB as well

author: pawandhananjay
content: geth is returning `beacon syncer reorging` on fcu calls, not sure what it means

author: marekm3498
content: or if it is possible to optimize or limit blob tx pool to be able to test on 8GB

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: geth seems to run oom as well

author: parithosh
content:
cc <@363800010518822915>  :
```
time="2024-02-01 14:44:07" level=debug msg="BlobSidecar not found in db, root=c078477fa702ddb0840a95f84f8d6365049520131455ccb2165063b1f0b0c634, index=2" error="open /data/blobs/0xc078477fa702ddb0840a95f84f8d6365049520131455ccb2165063b1f0b0c634/2.ssz: no such file or directory" handler="blob_sidecars_by_root" prefix=sync
```
can we safely ignore this? will it just fetch from network the next chance it gets?

author: terence0083
content: Yeah, we can ignore that. That means a node is requesting a sidecar from us that we dont have. It could be a lazy node that's requesting "everything" or prysm just sync'ed to head and doesnt have anything yet

author: lukaszrozmej
content: clients defaults should be set up for memory budgets
